page.title: 12LUNAN BAY, SALMON FISHING.
page.content: There are two firms carrying out salmon fishing at Lunan Bay. Both employ full time managers who live close to the beach, one being a fourth generation salmon fisher. The rest of the fishers are employed on a seasonal basis. The salmon fishing is carried out by Stake Nets. The stakes are embedded into the soft sand and nets are slung between them. The salmon swimming close inshore get caught in the pockets formed by the nets. In spite of darkness, gales or icy nets, twice daily, at Half Ebb Tide the men walk out along the nets to collect the salmon. The season commences on February 16th.and ends on the 31st. August. There is no fishing carried out from 12 noon Saturday until 6a.m. Monday morning.
